Post Description:
The overall median household income from work fell from $9,425 to $9,189 amid the Covid-19 pandemic. After taking into account inflation, this works out to a 2.4% drop in real terms.

The lower-income households were the hardest hit, with those in the bottom 10% seeing a 6.1% real decline in income.

Post Description:
The $600 Solidarity Payment aims to help households cope with the impact of the coronavirus pandemic.
For the majority of Singaporeans aged 21 and above, the one-off payout will be credited directly into their bank accounts by April 14. The rest will receive the payment by cheque, to be issued in stages later, starting from April 30.
Link in bio @straits_times
????: AFP
#coronavirus #covid19 #StraitsTimes #SGUnited
Comments: For everybody who is asking what about PR, please don‚Äôt take offence to what I am saying (I am a Singaporean, and my husband is a PR); There is a reason why some help can only go to citizens, and some help can go to both PRs/Singaporeans. For example, the TRF was open to PRs as well. At the end of the day, there is fine line between PRs and Singaporeans and why some help can not be extended to PRs. If you expect to be treated the exact way as Singaporeans, give up your citizenship and apply to be a Singaporean. Then you can face both the advantages and disadvantages of Singaporeans.
